===Kanji===
{{ja-kanji|grade=|rs=弓19|style=ky|shin=弯}}

# [[bend]], [[curve]]
# [[stretching]] a [[bow]]

====Readings====
{{ja-readings
|goon=[[えん]] (en) {{qualifier|rare}}
|kanon=[[わん]] (wan)
|kun=[[ひく|ひ.く]] ({{ja-l|彎く}}, hi.ku), [[ひきまかなう|ひきまかな.う]] ({{ja-l|彎う}}, hikimakana.u)
}}

===Etymology===
{{ja-kanjitab|わん|yomi=on}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=わん}} {{m|ltc|彎|tr=*quan}}. Compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} traditional {{m|cmn|彎}} and simplified {{m|cmn|弯|tr=wān}}.

Note that this character is replaced in modern Japanese by the simplified character {{m|ja|湾|tr=wan}}, rather than the simplified Chinese character {{m|cmn|弯|tr=wān||bend, curve}}. The Japanese simplified version means {{m|en|bay}} or {{m|en|inlet}} when used on its own, but now also includes the {{m|en|bend}}, {{m|en|curve}} meanings when used in compounds.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|acc=1|わん}}

{{ja-noun|わん|shin=弯}}

# a [[bend]], a [[curve]]

====Derived terms====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-l|彎月}}, {{ja-l|湾月|わんげつ|wangetsu}}: a [[crescent]] [[moon]]
* {{ja-l|彎曲}}, {{ja-l|湾曲|わんきょく|wankyoku}}: a [[bend]], a [[curve]]
* {{ja-l|彎屈}}, {{ja-l|湾屈|わんくつ|wankutsu}}: [[bending]] over, [[stooping]]
* {{ja-l|彎珠|わんじゅ|wanju}}: alternate name for {{m|ja|袴葛|tr=hakamakazura}}, a kind of {{vern|orchid tree}}: {{taxlink|Bauhinia japonica|species|noshow=1}}
* {{ja-l|彎入}}, {{ja-l|湾入|わんにゅう|wannyū}}: an [[inlet]] or [[bay]] along a [[coast]]
